page.title: 01Wells District
page.content:
Wells, a small city centred on magnificent cathedral and ecclesiastic buildings. New housing limited by Mendips and very low land. River Axe emerges at Wookey Hole, providing water for new St. Cuthbert's Paper Mill; old Mill site occupied by Hi-Tech Factory. Underwood Stone Quarry closed, opposite World War II POW camp site, now Thorne-EMI Electronics.
Centrally, Clare's factories, industrial garments, engineering and printing (Wells Journal), Tincknells Agricultural Merchant near Sheldon's Feedstuff Mill on St. Andrew's Mill Stream. At Keward, near Police Station are Unigate Processing/Packing Plant and Cheese Store.
